fr.sorbonne_u.cps.sron.election.components

Class ElectionNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
      • fr.sorbonne_u.cps.sron.election.components.ElectionNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI

    public class ElectionNode
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
    The class ElectionNode represents a component in an overlay network used to implement an election algorithm.

    Description

    Implements the Chang and Roberts algorithm (1979, source: Wikipedia, accessed on 2015/01/12).

    Implementation Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2019-04-08

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  ElectionNode.Candidate
      The class Candidate is the payload of an election message used to represent a candidate node in the first phase of the algorithm.
      protected static class  ElectionNode.Elected
      The class Elected is the payload of an elected message used to represent an elected node in the second phase of the algorithm.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int elected
      uid of the elected node.
      protected ElectionManagementInboundPort emip
      port used by third party components to manage an election over the overlay network containing this node.
      protected static int NB_THREADS
      number of threads used to process the messages in the overlay network.
      protected boolean participant
      true if the node is participating in the election, false otherwise.
      protected ElectionNodePlugin plugin
      election plug-in implementing the extension of the overlay network required for the election algorithm.
